events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a question posed by a male speaker, showing interest "with the music of the olden days for 11th century music." Another male voice provides an answer, expressing that for him it started with a group called "Garmarna." He heard them when he was 18 and was "totally hooked." They were "playing like folk rock versions of Swedish medieval ballads," and he notes that "that was the thing that started it for me". The speaker mentions that Garmarna includes a hurdy-gurdy, inspiring the speaker to buy one, followed by another voice saying "yeah". This second male speaker explains that he and Michael have known each other for a long time and have played folk music together in bands, some of which were folk rock bands. He continues, "since a previous band went into hibernation" then joking "Oh, this sounds menacing." That band went to the side and Michael had the idea of "bringing it from rock up to metal," slowing tempos down, "doing a lot of older melodies." He emphasizes that he has listened to medieval and early music since he was a teenager so he "was hooked on the idea right away." The first male speaker then speaks up again, mentioning "folk metal has been around for some time now."
